greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Coefficients of x in the partial quotients of the continued fraction expansion exp(1/x) = [1, x - 1/2, 12*x, 5*x, 28*x, 9*x, 44*x, 13*x, ...]. The partial quotients all have the form a(n)*x except the constant term of 1 and the initial partial quotient which equals (x - 1/2).
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
D. H. Lehmer, Continued fractions containing arithmetic progressions, Scripta Mathematica, 29 (1973): 17-24. [Annotated copy of offprint]
xref: Cf. A004273, continued fraction expansion of tanh(1), and A204877, continued fraction expansion of 3*tanh(1/3). - Bruno Berselli, Jan 26 2012
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 14 2005
